citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Item Attending veterinarian 2.40 a 1
At the time of inspection the program of veterinary care was asked to be reviewed, Licensee has changed attending
veterinarian, but has not completed a new program of vet care.
Licensee supplied the sign in sheet showing the new vet has visited the animals.
Licensee needs to have the new attending veterinarian complete the program of vet care.
Correct by 9/23/2021

Item 3.125 a
At the time of inspection the indoor housing area for the bobcat was reviewed. It was noticed that there was an area of
rotted surface along the base of the wall about 2 inches wide and 6 to 8 inches long.
This creates a gap in the surface in which the bobcat could get a paw or nail stuck, this therefore does not maintain the
enclosure in good repair to protect the animal.
Licensee needs to insure indoor and outdoor facilities shall be maintained in good repair and to protect the animals from
injury.
Correct by 10/20/2021
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Item Attending veterinarian 2.40 a 1 
At the time of inspection the program of veterinary care was asked to be reviewed, Licensee has changed attending 
veterinarian, but has not completed a new program of vet care. 
Licensee supplied the sign in sheet showing the new vet has visited the animals. 
Licensee needs to have the new attending veterinarian complete the program of vet care. 
Correct by 9/23/2021 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
Item 3.125 a 
At the time of inspection the indoor housing area for the bobcat was reviewed.  It was noticed that there was an area of 
rotted surface along the base of the wall about 2 inches wide and 6 to 8 inches long. 
This creates a gap in the surface in which the bobcat could get a paw or nail stuck, this therefore does not maintain  the 
enclosure in good repair to protect the animal. 
Licensee needs to insure indoor and outdoor facilities shall be maintained in good repair and to protect the animals from

injury. 
Correct by 10/20/2021 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End Section
